items.title: Hugo for Home
items.content_html: I finally got an awesome Hugo template up and running for my homepage and learned a lot in the process. It’s been rough but I’m glad I stuck it out since now everything rebuilds easily and quickly! I’m hosting it on Netlify for free and will think of it as a “digital garden” - a place to keep thoughts, notes, projects, and anything I want to craft. It’s also been nice to keep everything under one domain and use subdomains to help organize projects. In 2024 I’d like to eliminate about 6-8 domains that I’ve had over the years. I should be down to 3…not a bad pruning. (Until I’m tempted to buy again). üòÑ
items.content_text: I finally got an awesome Hugo template up and running for my [homepage](https://binarydigit.cafe) and learned *a lot* in the process. It's been rough but I'm glad I stuck it out since now everything rebuilds easily and quickly! I'm hosting it on Netlify for free and will think of it as a "digital garden" - a place to keep thoughts, notes, projects, and anything I want to craft. It's also been nice to keep everything under one domain and use subdomains to help organize projects. In 2024 I'd like to eliminate about 6-8 domains that I've had over the years. I should be down to 3...not a bad pruning. (Until I'm tempted to buy again). üòÑ

items.title: Retro Video Game Haul - Guitar Hero
items.content_html:
We’ve had a lovely weekend so far. I didn’t do much yesterday for my day off work, and today after taking care of some errands we went to the local retro video game store and found a second guitar for Guitar Hero (for PS2)! I remember buying Rock Band for PS3, and I loved the drum set. That might be on my list to re-buy now many years later for the nostalgia!

I also saw DJ Hero at the store, but it was missing a few pieces. I want to keep an eye out for a complete set with the game, for either PS2 or PS3, now that we have both consoles at home. I never had it and now am curious how it is since I’ve learned how to DJ earlier this year. üôåüèΩ
items.content_text:
We've had a lovely weekend so far. I didn't do much yesterday for my day off work, and today after taking care of some errands we went to the local retro video game store and found a second guitar for Guitar Hero (for PS2)!  I remember buying Rock Band for PS3, and I loved the drum set. That might be on my list to re-buy now many years later for the nostalgia!

I also saw DJ Hero at the store, but it was missing a few pieces. I want to keep an eye out for a complete set with the game, for either PS2 or PS3, now that we have both consoles at home. I never had it and now am curious how it is since I've learned how to DJ earlier this year. üôåüèΩ

items.title: VirtualDJ Software
items.content_html: Over the weekend I’ve been playing with VirtualDJ to mix music. I’ve been falling in love with the features of it and ease of use over Rekordbox or Serato. I’m really surprised I don’t hear about it more often! I’ve been reading opinions and I think people don’t move over because they feel “stuck” on what they know. I’m glad I found this early on in my hobby and I’ll stick with it. If I ever do a gig professionally where I need to rent gear, I’ll worry about using something else if needed. But for now I’m going to have fun with this and be creative!
items.content_text: Over the weekend I've been playing with [VirtualDJ](https://virtualdj.com/) to mix music. I've been falling in love with the features of it and ease of use over Rekordbox or Serato. I'm really surprised I don't hear about it more often!  I've been reading opinions and I think people don't move over because they feel "stuck" on what they know. I'm glad I found this early on in my hobby and I'll stick with it. If I ever do a gig professionally where I need to rent gear, I'll worry about using something else if needed. But for now I'm going to have fun with this and be creative!

items.content_html:
I’ve tried to make overnight oats for the first time. They came out really good!

1/2 cup of rolled oats, 1/2 cup of 2% (low fat) milk, tablespoon of chia seeds, tablespoon of peanut butter then leave in fridge for 8 hours.

When ready to eat, sprinkle cinnamon on top. No sugar added or needed!
items.content_text:
I've tried to make overnight oats for the first time. They came out really good! 

1/2 cup of rolled oats, 1/2 cup of 2% (low fat) milk, tablespoon of chia seeds, tablespoon of peanut butter then leave in fridge for 8 hours. 

When ready to eat, sprinkle cinnamon on top. No sugar added or needed!

items.title: Carbon App
items.content_html:
I was able to fork a copy of Carbon, a really nice site where you can create and share pretty images of code. It’s a great open source project that I was able to deploy with Netlify easily!

In case you also decide to fork and deploy your own version, I had to utilize this fix. Once complete it ran perfectly.

Feel free to bookmark carbon.binarydigit.cafe if you need it as well, or their official page carbon.now.sh/
items.content_text: I was able to fork a copy of Carbon, a really nice site where you can create and share pretty images of code. It's a great open source project that I was able to deploy with Netlify easily! In case you also decide to fork and deploy your own version, I had to utilize [this fix](https://github.com/carbon-app/carbon/issues/1438). Once complete it ran perfectly. Feel free to bookmark [carbon.binarydigit.cafe](https://carbon.binarydigit.cafe) if you need it as well, or their official page [carbon.now.sh/](https://carbon.now.sh/)

items.content_html: I nearly lost my mind yesterday when regex saved me an hour’s worth of work. I use Sublime Text for my very basic stuff (text edits, code) and the expression <img.*" /> let me highlight all the images in my story, then remove them (which is what I needed). Thank you @adam@social.lol for the help!

items.title: Discord Markdown Links and Safety Warning
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
A discord community member Kazama Jas posted this Tweet warning people that Discord allows for markdown and evildoers can use it to post links that are hidden. Here's the original tweet:

Since most people copy/paste a link into Discord and don't use Markdown to format links, this isn't something I would have realized. I know that Discord will show you the link when you click on it, but many folks probably ignore that and visit the site anyway. Someone on Twitter responded with a clever Automod rule that works well, so that non-admins cannot Markdown formatted links. Originally posted via Twitter.

  1. Open your server settings and go to Automod near Safety Setup under Moderation.
  2. Click on "Create Block Custom Words" or edit an existing default rule under Content.
  3. Click on the tab "Use regex patterns for advanced matching (optional) and insert the following:

[([^[]+)]((.*))

  1. Save and test with a non-admin account by posting a link in markdown.

Hope this helps you and your discord moderation!

items.content_text:
I've been down and out lately, so I decided to make a mood board with some favorite things I found on TikTok, Mastodon, other parts of the web, quotes I find etc.

It was created in Canva, with the "publish to web" capability. It's very nice to get a quick site up and running! It's not mobile friendly, but I'm not concerned about that at the moment. It will be updated constantly, so if you want to see it and check back on it, feel free. I hope it will lift you up as well and remind you how awesome you are. It's the perfect top level domain .rocks üòÑ

items.content_text:
Happy Friday! I realize I haven't created a link pack in a while so here are some sites I've loved lately.

Internet Archive

A non-profit library of millions of free books, movies, software, music, websites, and more. This includes the wayback machine which is the best way to search the history of over 826 billion web pages on the Internet.

SomaFM

Commercial-free, Listener-supported radio. I plan to throw them a couple of bucks because they have a good mix of stations, apps, and different bitrate qualities to chose from! You can use their mobile app, VLC or favorite media player to stream their stations.

Rooms.xyz

Create & remix interactive rooms from your browser. I haven't tried this one yet but have it booked marked since it looks like a bunch of fun!

Find more of my favorite sites with the link tag üîó

items.title: Tech Gear: FiiO M9 Media Player
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I've been wanting to re-build my personal music library offline for a while now, for 2 reasons: 1) nostalgia for offline content that I don't have to rely on a streaming service for and 2) building up a library for DJ sets which ties into point number 1.

I did some research and decided to look into the FiiO media player line. They have been popular amongst HiFi audio heads and since Apple doesn't make the iPod anymore (RIP, IMO worst decision they've made) I figure this would be a good alternative.

What I like about it is that you can use it offline, use it with high res audio (flac, OGG) files and you can expand the internal storage with a micro USB card. I miss the days of phones and devices using extra storage with a card, and this was a great feature. It also looks pretty snazzy too!

I went with the M9 model since I saw it on eBay used, and it was way more affordable than buying one new - which can range from $500 and up. I'm not ready to spend that kind of money since I don't have the high res music library nor super high quality headphones to take advantage of that high res audio quality. Hi end headphones are a whole new world and my wallet isn't ready ü§£

So far I love it. I can transfer my offline mp3 and flac files via USB easily; I know Bluetooth is an option and I've learned how to update the apps and side load apk's such as Tidal, Spotify, SomaFM, and PocketCasts, for when I do want to stream some audio and store it offline. I know you can use this as a DAC, but I don't think my ears are tuned to understand that yet. XD

If you're curious about all the options I've included the link to this particular player above. I'm currently using it with my Audio-Technica ATH-M50X monitor headphones, and I've been loving the separation from this and my phone or computer.

Do you use an mp3 player, DAP, or similar? I'd love to hear about it on Mastodon or comments below üòÑ

items.title: Popular Social Media Apps
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I go through this cycle every few months - get major FOMO from all mainstream social apps (Twitter, Instagram, TikTok, Bluesky) and want to post content there, and then sit back and realize it was all for nothing because I'm not missing *a thing*.

On Mastodon and Discord I love the nerdy/gamer/interest fueled people I surround myself with. They are interesting and creative and not afraid to be themselves. We can have conversations with like-minded (or not like-minded) folks and curate what we want to see. It's the nerd kids club. We're trying to bring more people in, but they don't want to try to figure out instances, or servers, or how to forward old accounts. It's ok for them not to care and ok for them to want to be in a central popular space. If new folks do end up joining a federated service, let's welcome them in with open arms and guide when they have questions.

Anyway, for I'll be chilling here in my nerd bubble just like I did when the web was young in the 2000's. I'll let my creativity flow when it calls, but I'm over the popular social media apps (for now). Also, to be clear, I'm not hating on anyone ever for mainly using the big social apps! They are useful for many, especially if you have a brand or business. I definitely know I could have utilized it more for my benefit in the past ü§¶üèΩ

As for my professional space, I'll keep that seperate, and keep the bare minimum needed for the job at hand. Maybe one day those worlds will merge, so we'll see!

items.content_text:
Lose It! App

I've been needing to lose weight for my health for about 10 years now, ever since I started my bad coping habit of eating food for comforting stress that started with a crappy old job. All my life, my blood levels were good (cholesterol, a1c, etc), so it wasn't really a priority to *really* take care of myself, even though I didn't like the way I felt for about 5-6 of those years.

This weekend however, after visiting my doctors for checkups, my levels are very close towards unhealthy for the first time in my life. It's also reflected my really poor self esteem and lack of confidence these last few months. It's scared me into action once and for all!

I'm back on my preferred food tracking app, Lose It!. I bought the lifetime membership to support the app, utilize the personalized meal plan, sync to Apple Health, along with other bonuses seen here:

It was much cheaper than the popular, MyFitnessPal, but just as good, if not, better. I love Lose It because even on the free app plan you can scan food and track it. (I sound like an ad but I'm not üòÖ)

Sleep

I've also started to sleep earlier each night starting when I visited home. In bed by 10pm, and my body has adjusted to sleeping quickly and waking up early, about 7am (even 6:30am)! I don't have to fight myself to get up which is wild. My body wakes up before my alarm. And this is all before I've even started to integrate walks or VR workouts daily.

Scale

To keep track of my weight, I'm going to weigh in each week with a bluetooth scale I bought from Amazon. The company is Renpho, and this is the scale I have which is super affordable and bluetooth connected. The best thing about the Renpho app (on iOS) is that it can sync to your Apple Health data, which then links to my Lose It app.

Movement

Lastly, I need to start moving again. I've posted about VR for fitness last time which I need to take advantage of. We've had pretty bad air quality due to the Canadian wildfires these last few days after coming back home from NY, so as soon as the air is safe again I'm headed outside. But this weekend should be nice a long due to the 4th of July holiday, so I'm going to do some Beat Saber or Synth Riders this afternoon. üëü

I'll post an update once a month to keep track of how I'm feeling and doing. Wish me luck! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçü©π

items.content_text:
This week my goal has been to do about 30 minutes of VR games that make me move...let me tell you, it changes my mood immediately! Why not use these cool gaming toys that I have instead of letting them sit there collecting dust? And get some physical activity out of it. üôåüèΩ

My boyfriend and I were able to join a voice call (ironically, from next door) and play some Beat Saber together üòÜ They need the ability for us to be in a server and leave it open for people to join - right now you need to explicitly invite friends or people on your Meta recently played list. I recommend both of these games since you can also purchase extra music tracks or even make your own levels with your own music (although I haven't tried that yet).

Here's to moving more ü§ûüèΩ

items.content_text:
I have a huge love for omg.lol sites - so much so that I have 3 URLs now. On one of them I didn't have much to host since it was a bit redundant from having a homepage and this blog (with 2 different domains). But lately I've been filled with nostalgia from the old web 2.0 days (from what I consider 2003 to about 2010ish) and so, am going back to the indie web.

The other day I found 32 Bit Cafe (awesome name üòÜ) via Pink Gallica (a lovely blog!) and they are a community of website hobbyists and professionals wanting to make the personal web fruitful again - exactly what I want! They've inspired me to start up a retro web page and make it filled with resources similar to sadgrl.online, where I found a great layout designer as a starting point. I could also do this on Neocities, but I might use that for another type of retro-site or project. I promise to keep it old-school looking either way! Chatbox included üíú

I'm going to list it on Github/Codeberg and keep it open source for others to use as well. I'll make a new post about that later. Hope you enjoy it!

items.title: Another Year üéÇ
items.content_html:
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
It's kind of hard to put into words how grateful I am to be here. I'm in Michigan with my amazing boyfriend, his two awesome pups, in a house with my own game room/office, a big yard, a safe space. My parents are healthy, my brother is doing well, and I'm feeling decently. I know not many people get to make it to their 40s, but here I am feeling younger than ever to be honest. It's weird to express happiness and not make it sound like gloating, but friends have made sure to tell me that it's important to celebrate it as well. So thank you for anyone that reads this, and for everyone I've met in my community, for everyone who's back home in NY that I hope to see soon, and to my amazing boyfriend Keith who makes my world go round and my heart feel safe. I hope I get to spend the rest of my life with you, Pixel and Luna.

I hope everyone kicks ass today! üíñü•∞

via GIPHY

items.content_text:
*Updated 5/26/23

I wanted to show the terminal setup I use for my dev environment. I have the same setup whether I‚Äôm on Mac or linux (Ubuntu) ‚Äì but below is the setup I like to use on my Macbook Pro.

iTerm2

Instead of using the default terminal that‚Äôs built into MacOS, I love to use iTerm2. This is because iTerm2 allows for tons of customized configurability as well as my fave feature ‚Äì split panes. It comes in hand when you need to run a few processes or log into various systems at the same time, without needing to open multiple windows and dock them a particular way. (For Linux I recommend Tilix!)

You can download iTerm2 directly from their website and drag to your Applications folder.

Oh-My-Zsh

Starting with MacOS 10.15, the default shell is zsh, whereas before it was bash. (If you‚Äôre on an early version of MacOS, you can use homebrew to install it quickly with the command brew install zsh.)

I like zsh because it allows for customizability. For even more features I love using Oh-My-Zsh, a popular plugin framework that‚Äôs community-driven and includes 200+ optional plugins and over 100 themes.

Install with the command

sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.github.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)"

You‚Äôll then be prompted to install the command line tools for MacOS:

install command line dev tools

After installing the command line dev tools, rerun the command to install Oh-My-Zsh.

Customize All the Things!

If you want to customize your theme like I usually do, you‚Äôll need to edit your .zshrc config file located in your home directory:

My favorite theme currently is ‚ÄúSMT‚Äù, but you can change to whichever one your like from the Oh-My-Zsh site.

In the .zshrc config file, change the line:

ZSH_THEME="robbyrussell"
to
ZSH_THEME="smt" or whatever theme name you choose.

Close the terminal then open it back up to see new theme.

To customize my theme even more, I usually change the character ‚ÄúÁ¶è‚Äù to an emoji that I prefer ( ‚≠êÔ∏è or ‚òïÔ∏è etc). Open up your them config file in your favorite text editor:

open ~/.oh-my-zsh/themes/smt.zsh-theme

Then I search for the ‚ÄúÁ¶è‚Äù character and add my emoji or text:

edit your prompt‚Ä¶or not

Close the terminal then open back up to see the new line:

As a last step, I change my terminal colors like I change my mood. My latest fave terminal theme is Dracula. It‚Äôs available for nearly every software and terminal around!

Download the one for iTerm and follow instructions. Behold the beauty before your eyes!

beautiful terminal

That‚Äôs basically it! There are tons of things you can customize but this is the setup that I‚Äôve used for a while now. I hope you‚Äôve enjoy this post and let me know how you customize your terminal!

items.content_text:
Hitsville, USA

When my parents and brother were in town, we did so much around Detroit and locally! Lots of going out to eat, random little shops, a little bit of gambling ü§´ and tons of walking.

My favorite stop of the week was visiting the birthplace of Motown! I took tons of photos but here are a couple:

I loved that we were able to sing in Studio A where most of the recording where. I loved imaging the superstars going in and out to record their hits ü§Ø

Travel

My brother is a musician so we drove down a few hours to Fort Wayne, IN to visit Sweetwater! I bought a new microphone for my DJ controller and streams üé§

Retro

We also went to a few retro stores and my partner picked up some games for his streams on the Sega Genesis and Dreamcast :D I also unpacked some more stuff that my parents brought over and felt good to build my racing wheel and put away more kitchen appliances and dishes. And we also finally hung up our awesome console illustrations that we bought off Etsy!

I can't wait for more lovely summer weekends!

items.title: A Lovely Weekend
items.content_html:
Yesterday my partner and I met up with our D&D crew. It was awesome since 1) we hadn’t met up in a few months due to scheduling challenges and 2) we had two more friends join our campaign! It was a great time since they were also experienced, so we felt even more comfortable with them there. I still need more practice to get comfortable with improve, but that will come with time. Today we slept in then went to a local retro video game store that we’ve wanted to check out for a while. We were pleasantly surprised at how much they had in store! He grabbed some great Playstation 1 games and I was happy to find that they sold lots of D&D merch! I bought my first pair of dice and they are beautiful üòç

I also grabbed this adorable Animal Crossing bell plushie - how could anyone resist the cuteness?

We plan to visit our local more and more now that we’ve discovered it!

I hope to capture more moments on my blog now that I’ve joined the IndieWeb and want to publish on my own site here then syndicate elsewhere (POSSE). Thanks for reading ‚≠ê

Here's the back of it since I don't want to doxx myself üòÖ We plan to visit our local more and more now that we've discovered it! I hope to capture more moments on my blog now that I've joined the IndieWeb and want to publish on my own site here then syndicate elsewhere (POSSE). Thanks for reading ‚≠ê

items.title: Indieweb for Wordpress
items.content_html:
There are a bunch of features I’ve enabled via the Indieweb plugin for Wordpress.

Some of these plugins allow you to:
items.content_text:
There are a bunch of features I've enabled via the Indieweb plugin for Wordpress. Some of these plugins allow you to:
  • send and receive comments, likes, reposts, and other kinds of post responses using your own site
  • allow comments on others‚Äô sites to show up as comments on your posts
  • help make IndieWeb comments and mentions look better on your site
  • allow support for webmentions
  • add location support to your posts
  • more easily syndicate your content to other sites to take advantage of network effects and other communities while still owning all of your original content
  • link to syndicated versions of a post so that comments on your content in silos like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram can come back to your original post as comments there
  • set up a MicroPub Server to use other posting interfaces. (You could potentially use services like Instagram, Foursquare, and others to post to your WordPress site.)
  • Use your site to log into other services with IndieAuth
I'm going to test things out and find other Indieweb writers, as well as try to join the Indieweb chat that's not discord, since I feel the discord bridge isn't the best. Time to post more content to my own blog and then distribute!

items.content_text:
I've been waiting for the pre-order for the new Street Fighter and Higround keyboard collab! It's finally here and I went for the Mashup keeb üòç I can't wait to add it to my collection!

This will be my second Higround board (after receiving the Epic of Higround keyboard as a gift a while back from my boyfriend)! Seen here:

It's been my go to lately because the reds and "thunk" feel so good for everyday use *and* gaming. I had to grab another and what better collab than Street Fighter, the GOAT of all fighting games (ok Maybe Mortal Kombat is tied with that). I also can't wait for Street Fighter 6 to come out in June right in time for my birthday!

items.content_text:
A short list of websites I find cool or fun!

Better World Books

Online bookseller that collects and sells new and used books online, matching each purchase with a book donation. Each sale generates funds for literacy and education initiatives in the U.S., the UK, and around the world. I always try to buy my book club books here instead of buying new! They always have even more sales on top of existing prices.

Carbon

Create and share beautiful images of your source code. On a relat ed note, there's a Wordpress Plugin that's also awesome to do the same thing: Code Block Pro

# Hello World!

Inoreader

I've tried many RSS readers, even self-hosted ones, but I keep coming back to Inoreader. They usually have good sales on the "Pro" pricing each year, and I enjoy the layout and ease of adding new sites to my feeds, as well as the recommendations to related websites.

<!-- raw HTML omitted -->

<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
<!-- raw HTML omitted -->
items.content_text:
I've been a fan of RSS since the beginning days of the web. I loved Google Reader (the best RSS reader) and after that Feedly and Inoreader. When Twitter and Instagram came along, I've never enjoyed getting news from those sources since they weren't direct and very fleeting.

Lately I'm trying to use free and/or open source software for as many things as I can, and don't want to pay for Inoreader any more (even though it has great features, but I don't use them). I was looking for a self-hosted install since I have free shared hosting and the latest option I found is FreshRSS which seems promising.

It was super easy to install on my shared host with a MySQL database. The biggest feature I'd need is a "reader" mode, where it pull in the entire article rather than just the summary. I'll check out the list of plugins and see what's available.

items.title: Photography, Editing, Cameras
items.content_html:
I have a couple of cameras that I’ve collected over the years from days where I dream of doing photography full time. I debate on selling them, but at this point I might keep them around because I still hang onto them hoping to shoot again as a hobby. Here’s my list!

I have a Canon 5D Mark III. It was my dream camera for the longest time, ever since I wanted to learn how to shoot editorial, portrait and e-sports photography. As a full frame DSLR, it’s a classic and a hefty tool, which I might regret getting rid of so I’ll hang on for a bit longer üòÇ I pair it with a Canon EF 35mm f/2 as my only lens (so far). I bought it used from B&H and haven’t had any problems with it, so no regrets.

I also have a Fujifilm X-T20, which I love because it’s lighter, mirrorless, has 4K video, and I’m able to use it for streaming with an Elgato capture card. So not only is it not collecting dust while I don’t go out for photos, at least I can use it for Twitch and recording video with my PC üòÑ

My Fuji love began with my X-T10, which I would love to sell since it’s a bit redundant since I upgraded to the T-20. Along with both cameras I have a ridiculous amount of lenses that I’ve purchased and gotten as gifts throughout the years. I definitely need to sell them eventually, but they are gorgeous bits of glass. I even had a Fujifilm X-T2 at one point, but loved the smaller body of the XT series and I knew I wouldn’t utilize the pro features of the XT2 at the time.

I used to love Adobe Lightroom back when you could purchase a single license and use it for a while. When they went to CC subscriptions, I did a couple of years of the Photoshop/Lightroom bundle, but after a while couldn’t justify the fact that I didn’t need huge catalogs and editing for a family portrait shoot now and again.

This year I discovered that Capture One has an Express version for Fuji and Sony cameras. Sweet! I claimed my license for the Fujifilm version and can’t wait to learn it. I can pair it with my Affinity Photo software for the few times I edit photos.

I also bought Flickr Pro this Black Friday since it was a great deal and I want to rebuild my portfolio. I had the unfortunate mistake of enabling the auto-uploadr on my phone app, then disabling it since I didn’t want to use it, and Flickr removed all of my public photos in my gallery. Doesn’t seem right, but also I didn’t reach out to support since I only had about 10 photos posted. Still frustrating and a warning for those who might do the same thing! Lessons learned

Originally posted at: https://binarydigit.micro.blog/2022/12/06/114638.html
items.content_text: I have a couple of cameras that I've collected over the years from days where I dream of doing photography full time. I debate on selling them, but at this point I might keep them around because I still hang onto them hoping to shoot again as a hobby. Here's my list! I have a Canon 5D Mark III. It was my dream camera for the longest time, ever since I wanted to learn how to shoot editorial, portrait and e-sports photography. As a full frame DSLR, it's a classic and a hefty tool, which I might regret getting rid of so I'll hang on for a bit longer üòÇ I pair it with a Canon EF 35mm f/2 as my only lens (so far). I bought it used from B&H and haven't had any problems with it, so no regrets. I also have a Fujifilm X-T20, which I love because it's lighter, mirrorless, has 4K video, and I'm able to use it for streaming with an Elgato capture card. So not only is it not collecting dust while I don't go out for photos, at least I can use it for Twitch and recording video with my PC üòÑ My Fuji love began with my X-T10, which I would love to sell since it's a bit redundant since I upgraded to the T-20. Along with both cameras I have a ridiculous amount of lenses that I've purchased and gotten as gifts throughout the years. I definitely need to sell them eventually, but they are gorgeous bits of glass. I even had a Fujifilm X-T2 at one point, but loved the smaller body of the XT series and I knew I wouldn't utilize the pro features of the XT2 at the time. I used to love Adobe Lightroom back when you could purchase a single license and use it for a while. When they went to CC subscriptions, I did a couple of years of the Photoshop/Lightroom bundle, but after a while couldn't justify the fact that I didn't need huge catalogs and editing for a family portrait shoot now and again. This year I discovered that Capture One has an Express version for Fuji and Sony cameras. Sweet! I claimed my license for the Fujifilm version and can't wait to learn it. I can pair it with my Affinity Photo software for the few times I edit photos. I also bought Flickr Pro this Black Friday since it was a great deal and I want to rebuild my portfolio. I had the unfortunate mistake of enabling the auto-uploadr on my phone app, then disabling it since I didn't want to use it, and Flickr removed all of my public photos in my gallery. Doesn't seem right, but also I didn't reach out to support since I only had about 10 photos posted. Still frustrating and a warning for those who might do the same thing! Lessons learned Originally posted at: https://binarydigit.micro.blog/2022/12/06/114638.html

items.content_text:
Ingredients:

  • ~1/2 cup sugar to caramelize
  • 1 can condensed milk
  • 1 can evaporated milk
  • 6 eggs
  • 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
  • 1 inch of regular milk from bottom of blender (mom's description ü§£ I think it's a cup?)
  • pinch of salt

Steps:

  1. Heat sugar in small pan on medium-high heat with 1/2 teaspoon of water. Stir occassionally until sugar melts and is a golden color. Remove from heat as it will still be melting.
  2. Pour into an oven safe pyrex dish or baking pan
  3. Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, vanilla extract, and regular milk, salt into the blender and blend for a minute until all mixed together
  4. Pour into a pyrex or oven safe pan
  5. Bake in a water bath at 350¬∞F until a knife can through it cleanly (or what my mom calls ‚Äúa little wiggle on top‚Äù üíì)
  6. Cool in fridge for a few hours or ideally, overnight
  7. When ready to serve, flip into deep service dish or pan

items.title: Deleting Tweets
items.content_html:
If you want to stay on the birdsite platform but delete old tweets, https://tweetdelete.net/ has been awesome! I paid for this service months ago (since I can run an automated task to delete tweets ever x amount of time) but the free version is still useful. The premium version is very nice if you want to bulk delete tweets, and it’s a one time payment for life.

Originally posted at: https://binarydigit.micro.blog/2022/11/11/094348.html
items.content_text: If you want to stay on the birdsite platform but delete old tweets, https://tweetdelete.net/ has been awesome! I paid for this service months ago (since I can run an automated task to delete tweets ever x amount of time) but the free version is still useful. The premium version is very nice if you want to bulk delete tweets, and it's a one time payment for life. Originally posted at: https://binarydigit.micro.blog/2022/11/11/094348.html

items.title: DuckDuckGo's Beta Email Protection Service
items.content_html:
DuckDuckGo Email Protection is a free email forwarding service that removes multiple types of hidden email trackers¬†and¬†lets you create unlimited unique private email addresses on the fly without switching email providers or apps.

We‚Äôve also added new features like Link Tracking Protection that helps prevent tracking in email links, Smarter Encryption that helps with unencrypted email links, and the ability to reply directly from your Duck Addresses.

I’ve registered two of my email addresses and forwarded them to my most used accounts. I haven’t tried the unique private address feature yet but can’t wait to! When you sign up for an emailaddress@duck.com it forwards to your normal email address and let’s you know if there are any trackers below the send to fields.

I recommend everyone grabbing their handle @duck.com so you can take advantage of email forwarding and check out their unique private address feature too!

Originally posted at: https://binarydigit.micro.blog/2022/11/09/i-love-duckduckgos.html

We‚Äôve also added new features like Link Tracking Protection that helps prevent tracking in email links, Smarter Encryption that helps with unencrypted email links, and the ability to reply directly from your Duck Addresses. I've registered two of my email addresses and forwarded them to my most used accounts. I haven't tried the unique private address feature yet but can't wait to! When you sign up for an emailaddress@duck.com it forwards to your normal email address and let's you know if there are any trackers below the send to fields. items.title: A New Beginning
items.content_html:
A new beginning in many ways - In terms of travel I moved from New York City to Detroit! (I’ll do more posts on that later.) On the digital side of life I’m slowly moving away from Instagram and now Twitter. It’s now a hot mess that I really want to avoid using for personal connection. I’ll still use those sites occasionally, but not nearly as often I used to.

Recently I returned backto the #fediverse on #Mastodon ‚Äì but had to migrate from my original instance at mastodon.technology where I was for a year or so. I settled upon Fosstodon, which has been my happy place for the last few days. I‚Äôm bringing it back to my roots of the early 2000s, where blogging was a thing, and social media wasn‚Äôt even around. Later social media was a nice feature to keep in touch with friends, but now it‚Äôs become both cesspool of business focused marketing an empty shell of no personalities (which I was a part of üòÖ). It‚Äôs tough to find actual good conversations now.

When Twitter and Tumblr first started, I loved them! You could spit out fun memes or random thoughts and it wasn‚Äôt a big deal. You could comment back and forth, and even put friends on a blogroll ‚Äì remember those? or webrings? They were awesome to find new people to follow. Oh and let‚Äôs not forget RSS ‚Äì the best protocol ever! I ready a great toot from someone describing the falling of RSS that I forgot to bookmark ‚Äì basically RSS never displayed ads, and social media wants you to look at ads. ALL DAY LONG. So Google and other companies started to stop promoting RSS so that you could visit the social media sites to make money off of your eyeballs and data. It hit me like a ton of bricks!

I‚Äôve ‚Äúleft‚Äù Facebook (I only have it open for my work account), pretty much have left Instagram, and will slowly leave Twitter. I hope that the people who I do enjoy to read about move over to Mastodon, but no worries if they don‚Äôt. I‚Äôll need to curate my Twitter feed a bit more to focus on content that I like. I mainly use it to promote my Twitch livestream hobby and connect with other techs and gamers.

So yeah, I‚Äôm very excited to come back to a simpler web and leave other popular social media slowly. If you like this blog, please follow me or this blog on the fediverse! You can also follow me on my website/Tumblr where I collect my thoughts, import tweets, toots, and still post some other fun things. If you want to get in touch with me, find me on Fosstodon or Twitter (less and less) or leave a comment.
